intro: Schizeilema cockaynei, commonly known as the Cockayne's flax, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a head, which are typical of the daisy family. Schizeilema cockaynei is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid conditions. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
